meta.title: Complete Ethical Hacking & Cybersecurity Masterclass - Zero to Professional Pentester
meta.description: The most comprehensive ethical hacking program. From absolute basics to advanced penetration testing, web application security, network hacking, mobile security, and bug bounty hunting. Master networking, Linux, programming, OWASP Top 10, wireless hacking, social engineering, and become a certified ethical hacker.
meta.duration: 6 months (26 weeks) - Can be taken as 1.5 hour daily sessions
meta.level: Complete Beginner to Professional Ethical Hacker
meta.certification: Industry-recognized Ethical Hacker certification upon completion

program_overview.title: Complete Ethical Hacking & Cybersecurity Masterclass
program_overview.tagline: From Zero Knowledge to Professional Penetration Tester
program_overview.description:
This is not just a hacking course—it's a complete transformation into a cybersecurity professional. Whether you're a complete beginner with no technical background, an IT professional wanting to transition into security, or a developer aiming to become a penetration tester, this comprehensive masterclass will turn you into a highly skilled ethical hacker capable of identifying, exploiting, and securing vulnerabilities in real-world systems.

You'll master ethical hacking from ground zero to expert level: from networking fundamentals and Linux basics to advanced exploitation techniques, from web application hacking to mobile security, from wireless attacks to social engineering. By the end, you'll have performed 100+ hands-on labs, compromised various systems ethically, written professional security reports, and be ready for cybersecurity roles at top organizations.
what_makes_this_different: Starts from absolute zero - no prior knowledge required
Legal and ethical hacking methodology throughout
Hands-on labs with real vulnerable applications
Latest tools and techniques used by professionals

learning_path.phase_1: Foundation (Weeks 1-8): Networking, Linux, Programming Basics, Security Fundamentals
learning_path.phase_2: Core Hacking (Weeks 9-16): Network Penetration, Web Application Security, System Hacking
learning_path.phase_3: Advanced Security (Weeks 17-24): Wireless, Mobile, Cloud Security, Exploitation Development
learning_path.phase_4: Professional Skills (Weeks 25-26): Bug Bounty, Report Writing, Career Development

career_outcomes: Senior Ethical Hacker / Bug Bounty Hunter (after 6 months)

phase_1_foundation.title: PHASE 1: Networking, Linux & Security Foundations (Weeks 1-8)
phase_1_foundation.description: Build rock-solid networking and Linux foundations essential for ethical hacking. Master TCP/IP, operating systems, programming basics, and security fundamentals.

week_1_2.title: Introduction to Ethical Hacking & Networking Basics
topics: What is ethical hacking and why it matters
Setting up hacking lab environment safely
Kali Linux installation and initial setup
OSI model deep dive: all 7 layers
IPv4 vs IPv6 differences and implications
projects: Complete hacking lab setup with multiple VMs
week_1_2.practice: Configure 10 different network scenarios, analyze 50 packet captures

week_3_4.title: Linux Mastery for Hackers
week_3_4.practice: Complete 100 Linux challenges, write 20 bash scripts

week_5_6.title: Programming for Hackers - Python & Web Basics

week_7_8.title: Information Gathering & OSINT
topics: Google dorking and advanced search operators
week_7_8.practice: Perform OSINT on 20 targets (legally and ethically)

week_9_10.title: Network Scanning & Enumeration
topics: TCP connect and SYN stealth scanning

week_11_12.title: Web Application Scanning
topics: Nikto and dirb for web scanning

week_13.title: Vulnerability Assessment
projects: Tasks: Full recon, scanning, enumeration, vulnerability assessment, professional report
week_13.assessment: Phase 1 Exam - Networking, Linux, Scanning, Enumeration

phase_2_frontend_mastery.title: PHASE 2: Core Hacking & Exploitation (Weeks 9-16)
phase_2_frontend_mastery.description: Master system hacking, web application attacks, exploitation frameworks, and post-exploitation techniques.

week_27_28.title: System Hacking & Password Attacks
week_27_28.practice: Crack 50 passwords, escalate privileges on 20 systems

week_29_30.title: Metasploit Framework & Exploitation
week_29_30.practice: Exploit 30 vulnerable systems, develop 10 custom payloads

week_31_32.title: Web Application Hacking - OWASP Top 10
week_31_32.practice: Exploit 50 web vulnerabilities across all OWASP Top 10

week_36_37.title: Network Attacks & Man-in-the-Middle
week_36_37.practice: Perform 30 network attacks in lab environment

week_38_39.title: Wireless Network Hacking
week_38_39.practice: Crack 20 wireless networks, create 10 rogue APs

week_44.title: Phase 2 Capstone Project
topics: Scope definition and rules of engagement
projects: Tasks: Complete penetration test from external to domain admin
Deliverables: Executive report, technical report, remediation guide
week_44.assessment: Phase 2 Final Exam - System and Web Application Hacking

phase_3_backend_engineering.title: PHASE 3: Advanced Security & Specialized Domains (Weeks 17-24)
phase_3_backend_engineering.description: Master advanced exploitation, zero-day research, exploit development, and specialized security domains.

week_78.title: Phase 3 Capstone Project
projects: Option 1: Red Team Operation (full adversary simulation)
Option 2: Zero-day research and exploit development
Option 3: Advanced malware analysis and reverse engineering
Requirements: Advanced techniques, custom tools, comprehensive report
week_78.assessment: Phase 3 Final Exam - Advanced Security Comprehensive Test

phase_4_advanced_production.title: PHASE 4: Professional Skills & Career Development (Weeks 25-26)
phase_4_advanced_production.description: Master bug bounty hunting, professional reporting, certification preparation, and career development.

week_101_102.title: Final Capstone Project - Part 1
projects: Option 1: Full enterprise penetration test with red team tactics
Option 2: Bug bounty automation framework with AI
Option 3: Security tool development and release
Option 4: Zero-day research and responsible disclosure
Option 5: Advanced malware analysis and threat hunting
Requirements: Professional quality, innovative approach, comprehensive documentation

week_104.title: Career Launch & Certification
week_104.assessment: FINAL COMPREHENSIVE EXAM - Complete Ethical Hacking Assessment

projects_throughout_course: Phase 1 (Weeks 1-8): 30+ foundational projects - networking tools, Linux scripts, recon frameworks

Phase 4 (Weeks 25-26): 15+ professional projects - bug bounty tools, reports, career materials

Cloud Security: AWS, Azure, GCP, Container Security, Kubernetes
Mobile Security: Android, iOS, Mobile App Testing, Reverse Engineering
Forensics: Disk, Memory, Network, Mobile, Cloud Forensics
Reporting: Professional Reports, Executive Communication, Documentation

faqs.question: What is ethical hacking and is it a legal career path?
faqs.answer: Ethical hacking (also called penetration testing or white-hat hacking) involves legally and systematically testing computer systems, networks, and applications for security vulnerabilities - with permission. It's completely legal and highly respected. Companies pay ethical hackers ₹6-70+ LPA to find vulnerabilities before malicious hackers do. Certifications like CEH, OSCP, and formal authorization make this a legitimate, in-demand profession.

faqs.question: Do I need prior programming or IT experience for this ethical hacking course?
faqs.answer: No prior experience required! We start from absolute basics: Linux fundamentals, networking concepts, and then Python scripting. Whether you're a complete beginner or IT professional, this 26-week intensive program builds your skills systematically. Many successful ethical hackers and bug bounty hunters started with zero technical background.

faqs.question: What tools and techniques will I learn in this cybersecurity masterclass?
faqs.answer: You'll master 50+ tools including Kali Linux, Metasploit, Burp Suite, Nmap, Wireshark, Nessus, John the Ripper, and custom Python scripts. Techniques cover web application hacking, network attacks, wireless hacking, social engineering, malware analysis, cloud security (AWS/Azure/GCP), and mobile app security.

faqs.question: Can I earn money through bug bounties while learning this course?
faqs.answer: Absolutely! We dedicate a full module to bug bounty hunting on platforms like HackerOne, Bugcrowd, and Synack. Many students earn their first bounties while still studying. Individual bug bounties range from ₹2,000 to ₹15+ Lakhs depending on severity. Some skilled hunters earn ₹50+ Lakhs annually through bug bounties alone.

faqs.question: What certifications does this course prepare me for?
faqs.answer: This course prepares you for major industry certifications: CEH (Certified Ethical Hacker), OSCP (Offensive Security Certified Professional), CompTIA Security+, CompTIA PenTest+, GPEN, and cloud security certifications. We provide dedicated certification prep modules with practice exams and study strategies.

faqs.question: What salary can I expect as an ethical hacker in India and globally?
faqs.answer: Cybersecurity salaries are exceptionally high due to talent shortage. Entry-level: ₹3-6 LPA, Mid-level: ₹10-20 LPA, Senior: ₹25-45 LPA, FAANG companies: ₹35-70 LPA (India) or $130k-280k (USA). Freelance consultants charge ₹2,500-12,000/hour. Security architects earn ₹40-90 LPA at senior levels. The demand far exceeds supply globally.
